Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as an attack on freedom of speech and conscience, which are fundamental to democracy.
The bill is perceived as giving the government control over 'truth', likened to Orwellian censorship.
The submission argues that the legislation aligns Australia with authoritarian regimes like China.
There is criticism of the government's handling of COVID-19, suggesting that censorship during the pandemic led to negative outcomes.
The submission claims that open debate on COVID-19 treatments was stifled, which allegedly resulted in harm.
Notable Quotes: Unelected bureaucrats will silence speech in the public square. How Orwellian!
This Bill will bring Australia into line with the government of communist countries like China, policing legitimate speech.
Censorship did not give a good outcome in this instance and this Bill to enshrine censorship into Australian law and life is a chilling prospect.
